intro: Cryptangium insigne, commonly known as the golden cupflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that resemble small cups, hence its common name. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine, soft hairs. Cryptangium insigne typically grows in moist, sandy soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight.
